intro: Veronica rotunda subsp. subintegra, commonly known as the rounded speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and features small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters. The leaves are rounded and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover.
